website_summaries.verdict: This satisfyingly lightweight hiking shoe from Merrell earned a lot of cheers from the outdoor community for delivering in the areas of comfort and water protection. Its traction, arch support, and short break-in period were also commended. However, there were those who found this piece smaller than what they initially anticipated. Sizing issues aside, the Merrell Alverstone Waterproof can be a beneficial piece of gear for outdoorsy individuals because of its hike-worthy characteristics.
pros: The Merrell Alverstone Waterproof garners praise from a multitude of buyers for granting loads of comfort on the trail
The majority raves about its lightweight construction
Plenty of owners consider this Merrell offering as a superbly waterproof hiking shoe
About a handful of users are pleased with the arch support given by this pair
Its M Select Grip impresses several consumers with how it performed on slippery surfaces
The minority reports that this low-top hiker had a minimal break-in period
cons: Several purchasers frustratingly say that the Merrell Alverstone Waterproof runs narrow
A few wearers are displeased with the footgear’s lack of breathability

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 5 times on my feet. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend. Big fail on the laces. The positive: The shoe is comfortable, it's also fairly waterproof and appears to be durable. Thus, the potential to be 5 stars is all there. The negative: However, the thin leather side lace holders rip way too easily, which means you can't lace them up - rendering the shoe unusable - unless you hike or walk around with unlaced expensive shoes, which then are not comfortable or waterproof. Team Merrell needs to redesign this shoe so that the laces feed through durable plastic, metal, or nylon lace grommets - as they use on the Moab hiking shoe.
customer_reviews.author: PenroseTribar

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are very comfortable right out of the box! Fit was appropriate and as expected based off of reviews,I ordered my true size. I have high arches and these give wonderful support. The top of the shoe hit perfect and did not rub on my ankle bone. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Arch support AND stone clinging soles, fantastic hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I used these on a difficult desert hike right out of the box and they were very comfortable. These are my favorite hiking shoes! They fit my feet perfectly. I have a tendency toward plantar fasciitis and these shoes actually put wonderful pressure on the arch keeping it secure. The soles are tacky and clung to rocks like I was a gecko. I hesitated because of the cost, but worth the $!! I was blown away by these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: HAllbright

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking and/or gardening shoe
customer_reviews.text: Well made, true to size and really comfortable. This is a great women’s footwear item, and feels like it will last for a while. Has great traction for hiking, but the treads are spaced effectively to minimize the dreaded problem of trail pebbles getting wedged in your boots. These also stood up well to a day of rough gardening - stomping on shovels, kicking things into place, hauling things, etc. - without showing any noticeable wear or causing any foot strain/pain. They would likely also be a good choice for women pursuing other home repair or construction tasks, but haven’t had a chance to test this yet. Very happy with this purchase and can strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany W

customer_reviews.title: Breaks in fast
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a week before an Ireland trip and I was able to break them in. They are definitely waterproof. The bottoms help grip the trails a lot better than my trail runners. However, if there are a lot of large flat rocks that are wet, they do slip but that's to be expected. I've worn these on 4 different hikes from easy to difficult, and I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Goode

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my wife for work since she is on her feet all day and regular sneakers weren’t helping with the pain of being on hard concrete all day. Got these shoes and she loves them. She said they are very comfortable. She has very minimum discomfort when standing all day in these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: terri hodges

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Hiking Shoe!! Size 5.5
customer_reviews.text: Love these Merrell hiking shoes. They are so comfortable. I wore for the first time on Saturday and wore them all day and they didn't even begin to hurt my feet. I wear a 5.5 and they fit as expected. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Mohr

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: These hiking shoes are great. They are replacements for a pair of Oboz that I wore out. I have a hard time finding a good toe box for my long toes. I have had Merrell's mocs before but never thought about them for hiking shoes. I ordered a half size up to accommodate hiking socks. They required almost no breaking in. I have not tested them thoroughly in wet weather but in a few encounters with puddles they have kept me dry.
customer_reviews.author: KCB

customer_reviews.title: Not enough padding under toes & balls of feet
customer_reviews.text: These are true to size, well made, and needed no breaking in. I've worn them on short and long hikes, the longest was 11 miles. My complaint is that there's not even close to enough padding under the balls of the feet and the toes. I can feel everything! My feet start to really hurt around mile 5. I bought some insoles which help a lot but make the fit a lot tighter in the toe box. If I had it to do over, I would buy a half size to a size bigger and get some really cushy insoles. Then these would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Merrill Women's Alverstone  hiking shoes with great fit, function and support.
customer_reviews.text: I like the overall support I get from these hiking shoes. They were a bit stiff when new but after a couple of weeks, have softened a bit without compromising the support. The arch support is very good (I haven’t had to wear an orthotic arch support with these shoes , as I do with sneakers). The shoes hold my foot in good alignment. I chose to use them more often than my sneakers as they fit well, have good traction and give the support I need. I would recommend them. Just know they are stiff when brand new.
customer_reviews.author: CLG

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Love the higher arch for my Plantar fasciitis! Picked them up for a trip to Europe. True to size for me but seem slightly narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Lorelei T.

customer_reviews.title: No more wet socks
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. I had some ll bean high ankle boots but didn't like how they felt. These are so comfortable and sturdy. I feel like my feet have a good grip on the ground. The best part is using them when I walk my dog on wet grass at the Nature Preserve in the mornings. Definitely waterproof. Thinking about buying a backup pair.
customer_reviews.author: Kim H.

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend - love the Merrell brand.
customer_reviews.text: Worn a few times and no need for break-in periods, that was a nice surprise. I wear the regular thickness puma socks from Costco and I still have comfortable room (thinking warm thick socks for hikes). So in my opinion - don’t size up. I’m a 9, purchased a 9. Great shoes. I’ve tested with light water - also good there. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Claire W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love this shoe! I do not hike but instead were purchased for a trip up north and wanted to wear something that had durable traction on snow and kept my feet dry. These were perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Broken already
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes about a month ago and I can tell you that the waterproofing on them is fantastic. Accidentally put my left foot in a stream on a hike and it wasn’t even wet afterwards. However, I have broken the shoe lace eye loop and somehow ripped some rubber of the tread on the bottom. I thought spending some more money than I usually do would get me something that lasts longer, but I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: A great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had it that long but I read the reviews and they seem spot on. Quite comfortable. I ordered my size, a 6 1/2 and they couldn’t fit better. Have taken them on two hikes under 5 miles . Just waiting for winter and see how well they keep out the moisture.
customer_reviews.author: Vivgent

customer_reviews.title: Used
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately - I do not know how great these shoes are, because I received a used pair. Very disappointed. Was really looking forward to them.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Crunch crunch crunch
customer_reviews.text: I loved them! When I saw them and first put them on they fit and looked great, but then I started walking and the left shoes makes an awful crunching sound. It’s from the waterproof membrane throughout the shoe but it will drive me crazy while out in nature. I then read on their website other reviewers complaining of same thing. Returning, getting the non-waterproof version.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley D

customer_reviews.title: great traction
customer_reviews.text: I love these hiking shoes. I have always hiked in a trail runner, but decided I needed a bit more stability. They are great. I've done three hikes in them so far (8, 5 and 3 miles). They are lightweight and offer good support. They provide really good traction on wet terrain.
customer_reviews.author: LCS

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these hiking shoes. With my last pair of shoes, my toes would jam the front of the shoes anytime I was coming down a steep incline. It was a big worry when ordering these online, but they are so comfortable and my toes do not jam the front. I also wore them on slippery, muddy ground while coming down the mountain and I didn't slip at all!! I'd definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Jody Glickman

customer_reviews.title: Safe buy every time!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent brand - never lets me down. True to size every time. Sneaks even nicer color in person. Very comfy, virtually no uncomfortable break in period. Love these so much!
customer_reviews.author: Lj McLellen

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful & Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered a size 7 but they were a bit too small. Size 7.5 was perfect for me. I love everything about these shoes. I received them in the mail the day before we left to hike Pikes Peak. I wore them all day and then the next, and then the day we hiked they performed wonderfully. This is the first time that I have never gotten blisters while hiking! I can slip these shoes on and off without having to untie the laces (LOVE).
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Helms

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit like a glove right out of the box! They didn’t require any breaking in. I was able to go on a three hour hike on semi rough terrain the first time I wore them! I love my Merrells!
customer_reviews.author: yoginurse

customer_reviews.title: Out the ox, the fit is right!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoes. My old pair, that I’ve had for years started to come apart at the seams. I put them on right out the box, with no shoes and they’re so comfortable!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great. Lighter weight and perfect for summer hiking. The first day I walked 3 miles with no problems. Good quality shoe. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Cham

customer_reviews.title: Great Hiking Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these great hiking shoes - made well, wear well, built to last. Merrell's are reliably top notch. Shipped quickly, no problems!
customer_reviews.author: Lyle M. Back

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Love these. True to size and you don't really have to break them in. They are comfortable from the start.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product for my wife. She loves them. She says they’re the perfect shoes for hiking or long walks.
customer_reviews.author: Jlpz

customer_reviews.title: comfort
customer_reviews.text: a little stiff seems the material blend is a little different from past experiences with this shoe
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, great style
customer_reviews.text: My wife has always loved Merrill shoes. Met the expectations of a great fit, great support, breathable, and very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Nick K.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a light hiker for dog walks & trail walks in the woods. Merrells fit me well. I need a waterproof shoe simply for walking through wet grass. Sneakers soak right through.
customer_reviews.author: K.J. Meline

customer_reviews.title: Had to send back
customer_reviews.text: Looked like a stable hiking shoe- but it didn’t fit my foot correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Kromm

customer_reviews.title: Walker
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for walking on pavement and trails. Arch is higher than the normal shoe. Perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like these, they are perfect for my field visits for work. Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Darrla G.

customer_reviews.title: Great hikers!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these. They are great!!!! Breaking them in for our trip to WY!
customer_reviews.author: laura graves

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Wore everywhere on recent trip. Helped stabilize recent broken ankle.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Houser

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and durable!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! They are so comfortable! I will buy more!
customer_reviews.author: Marcie Gutgsell

customer_reviews.title: served their purpose
customer_reviews.text: You must wear thick socks with them because the inside sole is hard.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than stated size
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than stated size. Stuck with shoes I cannot wear, cannot return.
customer_reviews.author: JLD

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and well made
customer_reviews.text: They are exactly as pictured and very comfortable with no break in time required for me.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Logan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have problems finding the right workout or hiking shoe. I was not wanting to go though the shoe stores so decided to give ordering shoes online which I am normally not in the habit of doing. However, I hit a gold mine with these. Perfect. My feet do not hurt at all and I used to ache after walking 2-3 miles. Now, I feel I can do another 2-3 miles. They are say to clean, and are waterproof. I will buy these again and again.
customer_reviews.author: southern girl1211

product_meta.title: Merrell womens Alverstone Waterproof
product_meta.description: The Merrell® Alverstone Waterproof hiking shoe lets you enjoy every moment on the trail with its weather-ready construction, underfoot support, and reliable grip. Suede leather and mesh upper. Waterproof M Select™ DRY impermeable membrane seals out water while letting moisture escape. Interior is treated with M Select™ FRESH antimicrobial agents that help reduce shoe odor. Bellows tongue helps keep debris out. Plush tongue and collar. Protective rubber toe cap guards against rocks and trail debris. Traditional lace-up system for a secure fit. Heel pull tab. Breathable mesh lining. Removable Kinetic Fit™ BASE contoured insole provides flexible support and underfoot comfort. Compression-molded EVA midsole for stability and comfort. Merrell air cushion in the heel absorbs impacting shock. Molded nylon arch shank. M Select™ GRIP outsole provides durable traction on a variety of surfaces. 5mm lug depth. Imported. Measurements: Weight: 12.9 oz Product measurements were taken using size 8.5, width M. Please note that measurements may vary by size. Weight of footwear is based on a single item, not a pair.
feature_bullets: Merrell Air Cushion in the heel absorbs shock and adds stability
Merrell Kinetic Fit BASE removable contoured footbed for flexible support
